arm_group.description: Healthy newborns in Regular and Observation nurseries who are between 0-72 hrs of age. Infants with gestational age > or = 35weeks and birth weight > 2500g, who are hemodynamically stable, have no cardiorespiratory abnormalities and have no evidence of sepsis.  If a blood culture was drawn due to the presence of maternal risk factors (e.g. maternal fever, prolonged rupture of membranes), patients will be included only if the blood culture result is negative and in case of intrapartum antibiotic treatment, ancillary blood tests (CBC with differential, CRP) are also within the normal range

brief_summary.textblock:
Wide Pulse Pressure is frequently present in the normal, full-term neonatal population. This
      study will evaluate the frequency and persistence of wide pulse pressure in the neonatal
      population. Using a prospective study design in the Regular newborn and Observation
      nurseries of SIUH, North site. Healthy newborns that are between 0-72 hrs of age will have
      their blood pressures measured using the oscillometric method. This data will offer insight
      into whether the presence of wide pulse pressure in otherwise healthy newborn infants
      warrants further cardiovascular evaluation

clinical_study.brief_title: Frequency and Persistence of Wide Pulse Pressure in the Neonatal Population

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Infants with gestational age > or = 35weeks and birth weight > 2500g, who are
             hemodynamically stable, have no cardiorespiratory abnormalities and have no evidence
             of sepsis.  If a blood culture was drawn due to the presence of maternal risk factors
             (e.g. maternal fever, prolonged rupture of membranes), patients will be included only
             if the blood culture result is negative and in case of intrapartum antibiotic
             treatment, ancillary blood tests (CBC with differential, CRP) are also within the
             normal range

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Infants with gestational age < 35weeks or birth weight < 2500g and with evidence of
             neonatal sepsis either culture proven or clinically suspected.

study_pop.textblock: Healthy newborns in Regular and Observation nurseries who are between 0-72 hrs of age.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Frequency and Persistence of Wide Pulse Pressure in the Neonatal Population

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: This study will determine the incidence of wide pulse pressures in healthy newborn infants during the first days of life.
primary_outcome.measure: incidence of wide pulse pressures in healthy newborn

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Neonatology Chairman, Dept. of Pediatrics, & Vice President of Medical Education

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
